conclusion: The square lies in the xy-plane with its centre at the origin O, vertices are A(-L/2, +L/2), B(+L/2, +L/2), C(+L/2, -L/2), D(-L/2, -L/2) with charges +q at A and B, -q at C and D.
The distance from each charge to O is r = L/√2.
The electric field magnitude produced at O by an isolated charge |q| at distance r is E₀ = 2kq/L².
Using vector superposition, taking the positive x-axis to the right and the positive y-axis upward.
Charge at A contributes ½E₀ to the right and −½E₀ downward.
Charge at B contributes −½E₀ to the right and −½E₀ downward.
Charge at C contributes ½E₀ to the right and −½E₀ downward.
Charge at D contributes −½E₀ to the right and +½E₀ upward.
Adding the x-components cancels to zero.
The resultant field at O is directed straight downward with magnitude E = 2E₀ = 2√2 kq / L².
Final result: Magnitude is E = 2√2 kq / L², direction is perpendicular to AB, pointing from the centre toward the side CD.
